content:
"America is now a nation of tragedies, a battleground that is both undefined and omnipresent. To prepare us for a brutal grind and wind down of our liberties and expectations and standard of living, we have been plunged into an irregular war that is punctuated with disturbing bloodshed and moments of odd quiet."

~ Jared Yates Sexton

#neoliberalism #homeless #JordanNeely #violence

content:
"We are living through a vicious campaign of demonization and hostility toward the homeless. Networks like Fox News show endless videos of attacks by homeless people that present them as inherently unstable, violent and dangerous. Prominent voices speak of sweeping homeless people from the streets like trash, and cities have tasked the police with using force to solve the problem."

#homeless #JordanNeely #violence #scapegoating #FoxNews
/2

content:
"Why is it, in one of the wealthiest places in the history of the world, did Neely lack for a proper place to sleep and adequate mental health care? Why was he thirsty and hungry in a land of unimaginable plenty? Why, in the throes of crisis, was a subway car the only place he had to go?

There should have been something to catch Jordan Neely before he fell this far. Instead, a stranger choked him to death."

~ Jamelle Bouie

#homeless #JordanNeely
/1

https://www.nytimes.com/2023/05/06/opinion/columnists/homeless-jordan-neely.html

content:
@QasimRashid

A large - and mostly overlooked - segment of homelessness is caused by high rents, not addiction or mental illness.

Drug addiction and mental illness exists everywhere. Grinding, Dickensian poverty does not.

#rent #rents #RentSeeking #homelessness #homeless #unhoused #poverty #capitalism #MentalHealth #MentalIllness #Addiction #DrugAddiction #Austerity #Neglect #PrivateProperty

card.title: Invisible People
card.description:
We imagine a world where everyone has a place to call home. Each day, we work to fight homelessness by giving it a face while educating individuals about the systemic issues that contribute to its existence. Through storytelling, education, news, and activism, we are changing the narrative on homelessness.

Invisible People is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit dedicated to educating the public about homelessness to create policy change for more affordable housing and support services. 

Email: info@invisiblepeople.tv

content:
Wow, I just received a generous donation from someone in my community. I don't solicit donations, but they offered.

I can use this to cover things like gas, parking fees, and car maintenance, which are so crucial now that this vehicle is my lifeline. I can also do laundry. And maybe I could also find some summer-appropriate clothes from a thrift store to be more comfortable in the coming heat.

But maybe more importantly, I feel so much more supported and hopeful now. Trying not to cry, lol.

Eternal gratitude and positive wishes for the stranger who chose to have my back â¤ï¸

And many thanks to everyone else in the world who supports the #homeless in any way

account.note:
Homeless but hopeful.
Journaling my experience of living in a compact SUV.
Dreaming of a better future while making the most of the present, and embracing that journey wherever it may lead.

content:
So I just learned about something called Social Housing, which Seattle, WA in the US is experimenting with.

I read something about it working in Vienna for centuries.

Thoughts? Pros and cons?

#Housing #Homelessness #Houseless #poverty #homeless

content:
When my hard work is not enough,
I store away my treasured stuff,
With straight face and a heart thatâ€™s breaking.
Though everyone was always taking,
And never once did I stop giving,
Iâ€™m all alone and somehow living
Out of my car at seventy-two,
And I donâ€™t know what to do.

account.note: Dylan Bragg is an established lover of books, stories and literature. His lifelong study of language, poetry and music is supplemented by a Bachelor of Arts in classics with a minor in religious studies. Bragg is a senior research assistant and software developer at the University of Oregon College of Education. When not reading, writing or designing books, he enjoys playing the jazz bass and classical guitar.
